cons: Spinach may cause hard crystals to form in the kidneys. These crystals won’t dissolve and might make kidney disease worse.
Increase in the amount of uric acid caused due to spinach can also lead to joint pain, inflammation of joints and gout.
Spinach might lower blood sugar levels.
description: It is very low in calories and fats.its leaves hold a good amount of soluble dietary fiber.this leafy greens often recommended by dieticians in the cholesterol controlling and weight reduction programs.

Fresh leaves are a rich source of several vital antioxidant vitamins like vitamin-A, vitamin-C, and flavonoid polyphenolic antioxidants such as lutein, zeaxanthin, and β-carotene vitamin-A is required for maintaining healthy mucosa and skin and is essential for night vision.

Spinach leaves are an excellent source of vitamin-K. Vitamin-K plays a vital role in strengthening the bone mass by promoting osteoblastic activity in the bones.Regular consumption of spinach in the diet helps prevent osteoporosis (weakness of bones), iron-deficiency anemia.
name: Spinach
pros: It is very low in calories and fats.its leaves hold a good amount of soluble dietary fiber.this leafy greens often recommended by dieticians in the cholesterol controlling and weight reduction programs.

Fresh leaves are a rich source of several vital antioxidant vitamins like vitamin-A, vitamin-C, and flavonoid polyphenolic antioxidants such as lutein, zeaxanthin, and β-carotene vitamin-A is required for maintaining healthy mucosa and skin and is essential for night vision.

Spinach leaves are an excellent source of vitamin-K. Vitamin-K plays a vital role in strengthening the bone mass by promoting osteoblastic activity in the bones.Regular consumption of spinach in the diet helps prevent osteoporosis (weakness of bones), iron-deficiency anemia.
Spinach is LIKELY SAFE during pregnancy and breast-feeding when used in moderate amounts.
Young leaves can be eaten raw in a salad. Spinach is a great source of iron. Make sure to combine vitamin-C-rich foods such as citrus fruits with plant iron like spinach to improve absorption.
